330 cases are confirmed and one (1) is presumptive (referred to RRPL/NML for confirmatory testing)
57 cases out of the 331 cases are considered active (17.2%)

150 cases are in the Saskatoon area, 71 cases are from the Regina area, 62 cases are from the north area,  22 cases are in the far north, 15 cases are from the south area and 11 cases are from the central area
Twenty-six (26) of the cases are individuals in the 19 and under age category; all others are adults, with 51% of the cases are males and 49% are females
136 of cases are travel-related, 142 are either contacts or linked to a mass gathering event, 33 have no known exposures and 20 are under investigation by local public health
Thirty-six (36) cases are healthcare workers, although the source of their infections may not be health care related
A total of six (6) individuals are hospitalized; including five (5) inpatient hospitalizations and one (1) in ICU hospitalization
Four (4) Saskatchewan residents with COVID-19 have died. Saskatchewan now has a fatality rate of 1.2%
A total of 270 individuals have recovered (81.6%)
25,872 COVID-19 tests had been performed in Saskatchewan.
